did.unittitle:
Gary Muffly photographic negatives
1931
did.abstract: Member of University of Michigan Class of 1932. Negatives made in spring and summer, 1931, by Gary Muffly; include University of Michigan campus and buildings, construction of the Law Building, tug-of-war, and other student activities.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Gary Muffly (donor no. 6181) and came to the library in 1978.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Gary Muffly photographic negatives, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Gary Muffly was a graduate of the University of Michigan, class of 1932. During the spring and summer of 1931, he took many photographic images of campus buildings and student activities. Included are views of the construction of law school buildings, a student tug-o-war, and the games between the freshman and sophmore classes.

scopecontent.p: The Muffly collection consists of 43 photographic negatives (2 1/2 x 4 1/2") taken during the Spring and Summer of 1931.

controlaccess.head: Subjects - Visual Materials:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan--Students--Social life and customs--1931-1940.
